newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia Excelcomindo launches cellular network.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia Excelcomindo launches cellular network.

text.p: Indonesia's PT Excelcomindo Pratama launched a cellular phone network on Tuesday covering the national capital Jakarta as well as the west Java city of Bandung, the firm said in a statement.

Excelcomindo said the network, officially operating from Tuesday, is the country's third cellular phone network operator after PT Satelit Palapa Indonesia (Satelindo) controlled by President Suharto's son Bambang Trihatmojo and PT Telekomunikasi Selular (Telkomsel).
Telkomsel is a partly-owned by state-controlled telecommunications firms PT Indosat and PT Telekomunikasi Indonesia (Telkom).

Excelcomindo said it planned to expand the network to the country's second largest business city of Surabaya, East Java from November 1, 1996 as well as other major cities in the main islands of Java, Bali and Lombok by the first quarter of 1997.
Excelcomindo is 60 percent owned by Indonesian PT Telekomindo Primabakti and PT Santana Telekomindo and 40 percent by Nynex Corp, Asian Infrastructure Fund and Japan's Mitsui & Company Ltd, it said.
The statement did not give further details.
